title: How to get my papers published - Quora

response.answer_text: Publishing a paper is an extensive yet rewarding process. I would suggest you to follow these steps: · Do extensive research to make a list of available journals in your field of interest. Then, go through the journal scope, policies, requirements, distribution, peer review process, and impact factor to narrow down the journals that match your needs. · Next, carefully go through the journal’s author guidelines and follow them strictly to write your manuscript. · It is crucial to edit or proofread your paper a few times. You can also use professional editing and proofreading services like Enago. · Ask you colleagues or supervisor to review your paper and revise your manuscript based on their feedback. · Submit your paper to the desired journal through appropriate channels once you are ready. · Wait for the Editor’s and reviewer’s response. Your paper will either be accepted, or rejected, or accepted with revisions. · In case of any major revisions required, you will have to make more substantial changes to your manuscript and resubmit it. · If your paper is still rejected, re-write your paper and submit it to another journal from your selected journal list. Good luck with publishing!

Where do you want to publish it ? I mean Elsevier, IEEE , ScienceDirect ? If you have written your paper, just search for appropriate conference and submit your paper there. If that conference accepts your paper, further process they will intimate you. Note that plagiarism should be as less as possible so that chances for acceptance will be high.
[How to] Publishing A Research Paper | Practical Advice Check out the above link for the details as well as the video on how to publish a research paper. Thank you
You should first complete your research papers and then choose a journal that suits you best. After that fulfill all the criteria they have for publication and then submit them.
